programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When three victims are gunned down at a suburban bus stop, no one knows who the intended target was or what the motive could be. Detectives pursue every possible angle, until finally uncovering a conspiracy with an unbelievable criminal mastermind.

programme.title: ATL Homicide
programme.desc: Quinn and Vince respond to the scene of a gas station shooting that leaves a small family broken. While detectives narrow in on a local drug dealer, they find that their closest ally may hold the darkest secrets in this twisting investigation.

programme.title: ATL Homicide
programme.desc: In the late hours of the evening, a wife becomes a widow. As Quinn and Vince respond to the backyard shooting of a beloved husband, they uncover a string of murders spanning decades that occurred within the neighborhood.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When 911 dispatchers receive a call from a distraught newlywed about her unconscious husband, responding officers are shocked to find he�s a victim of strangulation, and investigators must determine if it was self-defense, or an act of revenge.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: Chattanooga began as a railway city and evolved into a mecca of arts and culture. But the city also has a violent history. And in 1979, one man's murder uncovers the city�s dark secrets and leads detectives all the way to the governor�s mansion

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a transgender woman goes missing in a small town, police suspect she may have disappeared in order to complete her transition, far from a family struggling to come to terms of who she was. But after a statewide search locates the woman’s car, investigators take a closer look at the men she met through online dating apps.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a 21-year-old woman is shot dead in a bad part of town, police have to find out if it was simply gang related or perhaps a twisted love triangle. It isn’t until two terrified young women come forward claiming to have witnessed the shooting, that the case breaks wide open.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: After a young bus driver suddenly vanishes, his body is discovered in a San Antonio cemetery. As investigators attempt to dig deeper, the truth comes to light as they uncover an elaborate murder plot, meticulously engineered by a master puppeteer.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: After looking for love in all the wrong places, a young mother believes she’s finally found her soulmate. But soon, her happy home becomes a house of horrors.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a beautiful teen with a bright future falls for a bad boy with a shady past, he tries to pull her into his life of crime. She has to decide how far she is willing to go for love and is forced to choose between her man and her moral compass.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A beautiful fashionista is swept off her feet when she meets a man who promises her the world. However, she discovers he has a dark secret. Consumed by love, she must decide how far she will go for him…and who she is willing to sacrifice.

programme.title: In Broad Daylight
programme.desc: Ripped from the true crime files of Fatal Attraction, a young woman fights for her life after being kidnapped by her obsessive ex-boyfriend, while her family will stop at nothing to find her.

programme.title: Stalker
programme.desc: A well-known Hollywood actress is suddenly tormented by a stalker. Her sister and high school boyfriend try to figure out who is tormenting her.

programme.title: Blood on Her Badge
programme.desc: After cold-hearted cop, Dee falls for an aggressive drug dealer they begin robbing drivers during routine traffic stops. Soon she starts taking greater risks, but her world comes crashing down when he convinces her to commit a violent robbery, resulting in the gruesome murder of three people.

programme.title: When Love Kills: The Falicia Blakely Story
programme.desc: All Falicia ever wanted was a better life and she found it with Dino. He promised her the world and all she had to do for it was to kill.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a pregnant woman’s body is found floating in the Hudson River detectives suspect suicide, but as new evidence surfaces, officers suddenly have a homicide on their hands. programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When an ambitious college student falls for a handsome security guard, she knows it’s true love. But when her man falls into the street life after losing his job, he pulls her down with him. programme.desc: A young dancer believes she’s found her soulmate when she meets a handsome man who promises to make her a star. Desperate to earn his love, she makes a deal with the devil – and for a shot at the spotlight it will cost her body and her soul.

programme.desc: After back-to-back tragedies have left her estranged from her family, a young woman finds the love and acceptance she�d always wished for, but when her man wants more for them, she�ll be roped into a devilish plot to take back what she left behind.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a young woman and the love of her life begin preparing a future together, they�re struck by tragedy with a miscarriage. And as the cracks between them begin to form, one woman will have to decide how far she�ll go to create a perfect family.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a woman is found lying in a pool of blood in her kitchen, her siblings immediately suspect who is responsible. Their lead adds surprising twists to the investigation, and detectives expose a fatal love triangle, violent pasts, and deep rage.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a young mother of four is found murdered in her home, police initially wonder if a stalker is to blame. But a routine traffic stop in another state will ultimately reveal a killer � and kidnapper � who would do anything to get away with murder.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Ayesha Turner lived a quiet life in southwest, Atlanta. One evening, that all changed. A few days go by and Quinn and Vince are notified of a missing person’s report. They begin their case of trying to figure out what happen to Ayesha Turner.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Carlton Benn was a great person who worked for CARE, a disaster relief company which provided disaster relief to those in need. One day in May of 2006, Carlton’s roommate reported to police that he was dead. Vince and Quinn immediately come to action.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: A man is found dead from a single gunshot wound to the chest, and at first friends suspect a possible suicide. But when investigators find evidence that points to foul play, a vindictive ex obsessed with revenge emerges as the prime suspect.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In 2013, Cleveland, Ohio is shaken when 911 dispatchers receive a call and three missing women are found in a house of horrors. Investigators uncover the truth behind a horrific string of decade old abductions committed by a city school bus driver.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: A lottery winner, business owner, and family man seemed to have it all until he was found dead inside his own van. Police suspect his multi-million-dollar fortune is at the root of his murder, but they soon uncover a dark and disturbing secret that sends shockwaves through his family.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Pamela Butler was established in her life, and in love. Then she vanished. Her family becomes frantic searching for answers as authorities find no evidence of foul play or anything suspicious on her home security footage. The case goes cold -- until a sudden discovery exposes a heinous pattern of deception and violence.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a 17-year-old transgender girl goes missing, her journey of walking in her truth comes to a tragic end. As investigators track her killer, they learn that she suffered bullying and misunderstanding � but is that what led to her death?

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: America's Game: The Super Bowl Champions

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Relive Super Bowl XXIX where Steve Young was able to put to rest any questions about his credentials to take over the 49ers after Joe Montana was traded away in 1993. Young set a Super Bowl record with 6 touchdown passes en route to the 49ers' fifth Super Bowl victory, the first team in NFL history to win that many. 49ers defensive back Deion Sanders intercepted backup quarterback Gale Gilbert's fourth-down pass in the end zone.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Kurt Warner and the St. Louis Rams were favored heading into Super Bowl XXXVI where the New England Patriots team was being led by its backup quarterback, Tom Brady. After a game winning field goal from Adam Vinatieri, the win against the Rams was the first Super Bowl victory in Patriot's history and was a launching point for their dynasty of the 2000's.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: More high stakes cash action from Las Vegas. Bomb pots make their explosive Big Game debut, leaving one player fuming and in need of a reload. Meanwhile, Loose Cannon Jordan Handrich faces off against UK pro Sam Grafton in a hand worth $40,000.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: It's a high stakes cash game in Vegas with an amateur player competing against the pros. Tonight, Jordan the Loose Cannon goes for bomb pots, while Jennifer Tilly and Sam Grafton spar in multiple hands, with tens of thousands of dollars on the line.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: Hollywood star Jennifer Tilly continues to crush, as the penultimate session of this high stakes cash game begins. Meanwhile, time is running out for the Loose Cannon to bank a profit, and Gerard Piqué tries to recover some of his five-figure losses.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: It's all to play for in Las Vegas, as this high stakes cash game concludes. Jennifer Tilly and Sam Grafton battle for supremacy, while Gerard Piqué is determined to finally get the better of the poker pros and dig himself out of a hole.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

He, Pahoo and Colorado Charlie travel to Missouri and learn that Jesse James has framed his friend for the crime. By the time Yancy and his friends arrive, he has only 24 hours to prove that his friend has been falsely convicted.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: On St. John's Eve, the city becomes terrorized by a mysterious voodoo priestess who is believed to perform a ritual as a means of covering up a murder. Colton is skeptical until he learns that a visitor engaged to the younger Dubois sister, has received a voodoo doll on behalf of the older sister. Yancy decides to observe the voodoo ritual to combat these superstitions.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: When Bat transports a large herd of horses to Fort Bowie, a gang stages an ambush, killing many of Bat's men and stealing the herd; Bat must use his wits to recover the horses and bring the killers to justice.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: A gambler establishes a casino in Bat's name and cheats his cowboy customers out of their money.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: Diego's attempts to hide Torres result in a marriage proposal.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: The captain uses Senora Torres and Elena as bait in an attempt to trap Zorro.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A janitor-turned-gunfighter's reputation hangs on one lucky shot and a lot of gall. The handyman finds himself in trouble when he accidentally kills another gunfighter.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After being foreman of a jury that convicted an Apache, Lucas is marked for death. Now, he must discover who is behind the curse.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas allows some snowed-in stagecoach passengers to stay with him until the roads are passable. Trouble brews when the whisky salesman and gunfighter fall for the same woman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride, using Lucas's name.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas recognizes Dr. Battle as an ex-gunslinger with whom he once fought. He helps with a dying man, but Lucas and the doctor have unresolved anger.

programme.desc: Mark takes a job as a stable boy against his father's wishes.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Milly are held hostage in her general store when two gunmen attempt a daring robbery.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas seeks an escape when he's captured by outlaws while seeking help for an injured Mark.

programme.desc: Mark befriends singer-banjoist Lafayette Bly, a blind man with an acute sense of hearing and a very strong grip.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A retired lawman's irrational jealousy threatens not only to destroy his marriage but also to make him an easy target for someone who wants him dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: No one is more surprised than Micah when newcomer Leota Carraway claims he's her long-lost husband and the father of her child.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The town of North Fork becomes a haven for outlaws when suave Ben Judson smooth-talks his way into the marshal's job.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A handsome gambler moves into town and begins wooing Milly Scott, claiming to have known her deceased brother.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas develops temporary amnesia from a head injury while visiting a strange town and mistakenly assumes the identity of a wanted criminal.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A former neighbor of the McCains' is released from jail after serving his sentence for robbery. Lucas lets the man work for him but the new hand holds a secret.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While trapped in the ghost town saloon, Lucas tries to come up with a plan to escape with his son and Micah after Mark refuses to leave without him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lou Mallory arrives in North Fork and starts buying up land and businesses. Lou and Lucas start disliking each other after she reveals plans to build a railroad on "worthless" land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When a woman arrives in North Fork with symptoms of smallpox, Lucas, Lou Mallory, Doctor Burrage and hotel occupants are quarantined in the hotel with an outlaw.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gunslinger Johnny Drako rides into town and tells the bartender that he is looking for Lucas McCain. After Johnny leaves the saloon, Sweeney hurries to tell Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An assassination plot unfolds as four gunmen disguised as cavalrymen enter North Fork. Their target: Sen. Jim Borden. Their weapon: a Gatling gun.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Sharpshooter Marty Blair tries to persuade Lucas to buy Mark a rifle. After Lucas shoots a man during a robbery at the hotel, Mark and Lucas disagree his character.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Fast-draw artist Wade Randall is in town, bragging of his gun battles with notorious bad men, until one of them shows up to challenge his story.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Lucas refuses to sell his land, Mr. Prescott will stop at nothing to to change his mind. He hires men to try to persuade Lucas, but he refuses.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Nils Swenson takes the marshal's place for a few days while Micah is away. To maintain peace, Nils insists that anyone coming into town must turn in their weapons.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas's self-confidence begins to slip away when he misses an easy shot that could have cost Mark his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A murder occurs at a railroad camp and a young Indian friend of Lucas' is accused of the killing. When Lucas tries to help the boy, he finds himself on trial.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark come upon Winslow Quince, a peddler whose wagon has broken down. They help him bring his wagon to North Fork for repair.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gridley Mau, the son of a man Lucas killed during an attempted robbery, comes to North Fork looking for revenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: At Halloween, rustlers take advantage of the seasonal disguises to raid a cattle ranch. Lucas' faith in his son's honesty is shaken when he hears rumors of Mark being mixed up with the thieves.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark stop on the way to the county fair to deliver a message to Micah, who is escorting a prisoner to be hanged. Mark and Lucas recognize the prisoner.

programme.desc: Lucas is torn by conflicting emotions when he meets the town's new preacher, a former outlaw whom the Rifleman vowed to kill.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Lucas, Mark, and Micah get lost in Old Mexico, they are held hostage by a group of bandits who intend to kill the men and take Mark as a slave.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While trapped in the ghost town saloon, Lucas tries to come up with a plan to escape with his son and Micah after Mark refuses to leave without him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lou Mallory arrives in North Fork and starts buying up land and businesses. Lou and Lucas start disliking each other after she reveals plans to build a railroad on "worthless" land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gunslinger Johnny Drako rides into town and tells the bartender that he is looking for Lucas McCain. After Johnny leaves the saloon, Sweeney hurries to tell Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A man arrives in North Fork, intending to marry Lou Mallory. The hotel owner looks for a way out from marrying the man to whom her dying father promised her.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must decide if she can perform a successful autopsy without the deceased's organs. As she ponders the decision, we are given a rare glimpse into a different side of Dr. G's job.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: A doctor opens a nurse's chest and takes her heart in his hand in a desperate effort to save her life.

programme.desc: A mountain biker has multiple injuries and her boyfriend has multiple fainting spells.

programme.desc: A first hand look at individuals who didn't expect to become human shish kabobs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors struggle to save a young man brought to the ER frozen and pulseless.

programme.desc: A violent convict may be faking paralysis as part of a prison escape plan.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man falls off a roof and is impaled by a shovel, a police officer has a heart attack and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An older patient with prolonged CPR; a stabbing victim on the street; a doctor's dream job becomes a nightmare.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two seemingly unrelated gunshot wounds lead to a bizarre night in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A night on the town quickly turns into a fiasco in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A grown man suddenly begins acting bizarrely like a child, a wheezing woman has a breathing problem and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A violent patient faking a coma holds doctors and police hostage after stealing a policeman's gun.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.desc: A young man has a 2-inch pipe through his head. A young bride is bleeding uncontrollably.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.desc: An embarrassing secret prohibits a heart attack patient from being rushed to the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen is bleeding internally from an ectopic pregnancy but denies ever having had sex.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A grown man screams incessantly, a young mother is ice cold and a boy denies overdosing on drugs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A snake bite victim may die in the ER because life-saving anti-venom is in short supply.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An off-duty ER physician diagnoses his own critical illness while en route to the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summer around the corner, Monty reveals his plans for planting up pots in his cottage garden, shares tips on how to start your own topiary from scratch, and in the veg garden, gets some pumpkins in the ground.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for one of the highlights of the horticultural year, the annual 'Gardeners' World Live' event. Monty Don, Nick Bailey, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, and Frances Tophill are on hand to bring the best the gardening world has to offer. There is design inspiration for even the smallest of spaces, plus big ideas on display in the show gardens, and all the latest trends and must-have plants and flowers in the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardening show packed with good ideas, tips, advice from experts and timely reminders.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The roses are in full bloom at Longmeadow as Monty tackles some emergency pruning needed on one of his favourite crab apples. Adam Frost travels to the Birmingham Botanical Gardens to discover more about the huge restoration project taking place.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In a special programme, Gardeners' World comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Nick Bailey and Rachel de Thame share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee to inspire us all to get growing!

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Horticulturists offer various techniques to elevate the home gardening experience, from repositioning roses in rustic layouts to planning vibrant spring displays.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "Here at Huckberry, we believe that style isn’t defined solely by what you wear — it’s personified in your morning rituals, your bookshelves and music library, the furniture you choose to spend your waking hours in, and the gear closet that powers your passions and pursuits. Style doesn’t end with your closet, it sparks to life there.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Meet Luke DiTella—once a pro surfer, now the founder of Frank August whiskey, and an all-around Renaissance man. Whether it's barrels at a Jersey beach break or barrels of aged whiskey, Luke knows how to turn life into an art form. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we take a deep dive into Luke’s world at his coastal haven in Monmouth Beach, New Jersey. It’s a place where the salty sea air meets the rich aroma of aged whiskey—a home that’s as rugged yet refined as the man himself. Luke opens his doors to share tales of surfing glory, entrepreneurial grit, and the beautiful chaos of fatherhood (spoiler: they don't care about your design aesthetic).

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Dean Petty is a man of many titles: surfer, carpenter, restaurant owner, coffee roaster. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, he takes us to "Camp Bueno", a minimalist surf sanctuary in Cow Bay, Nova Scotia, he built with his own two hands (and a lot of help from his friends). From a concrete kitchen countertop that took days to grind to perfection, to a barn staircase that turned into a viral meme, it's a place you won’t find anywhere else in the world.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger chase the full moon Wahoo bite fishing out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fish with Daiwa’s Marc Mills out of Plantation Boat Mart trying out all of Daiwa’s new jigging equipment.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Huckberry's flagship adventure series is back in Japan and the DIRT crew is hungry as ever for adventure. This time, they’re diving into the Kansai region—where millennia-old traditions flow from the shore of Lake Biwa to surf breaks on the coast. Chef Coleman Griffin gives them a taste of the deep cultural immersion that inspires his culinary practice, from chef knives descended from samurai swords to fermented carp that went on to spawn sushi. And turns out, the perfect meal does exist, and the crew knew it as soon as they had a bite of their final omakase.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Illinois isn’t the first state you think about when it comes to waterfowl, but the Wentz Brothers have dialed in some honey holes over the years. On this episode, a slew of waterfowl experts put to the test some of the newest Winchester waterfowl ammunition during the great migration of the Mississippi Flyway in early December. We’ll also head north to the shores of Kodiak Island, Alaska with Chris and Casey Keefer as they push the limits of Winchester’s new Last Call Double Shot on fast-ripping sea ducks.GUESTS: Zach Wentz (Team Winchester) Nathan Robinson (Winchester Ammunition) Ryan Swaner (Winchester Repeating Arms) Chris Jennings (Ducks Unlimited) Mike Brasher (Ducks Unlimited) Scott Olmsted (American Hunter) Travis Hall (Field & Stream) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Col. Nick Nichols from Folds of Honor and Olympic skeet shooter Dania Vizzi are both proud Americans who have represented their country overseas. Col. Nichols commanded the air in the cockpit of a fighter jet for countless missions during his seven combat tours and Dania donned the stars and bars proudly on her shooting vest as an Olympian in Paris. Now with Winchesters in hand, both are in the Midwest whitetail woods during late November during the back end of the rut hoping to connect on a Missouri monarch.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Every April, 60 college kids from around the country attend Living Lands and Waters’ unique “Alternative Spring Break” program – trading happy hours and beach tans for spending a week on McKellar Lake with founder Chad Pregracke and his inspiring river rat crew as they clean up the Mississippi River’s waterways and learn about river-related careers.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: This spring, Rivers are Life proudly partnered with The Little Forks Conservancy for a stream sampling event along Michigan’s Cedar River—a vital part of the watershed that eventually flows into Saginaw Bay.Held on May 17 at the Gladwin Conservation District’s Community Garden, the event brought together Citizen Scientists from across the state. Volunteers were divided into teams and sent to six different sites along the river to collect insect nymphs and larvae—tiny but mighty indicators of water health.Over 223 specimens were gathered, from stoneflies and mayflies to dragonfly larvae. These macroinvertebrates are highly sensitive to their environment, and their presence (or absence) can tell us a lot about the state of the river.The results? Based on initial identifications, the Cedar River shows signs of excellent water quality—making it one of Michigan’s prized Blue Ribbon Trout Streams.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Dow employees, their family and friends, and Katie from Rivers are Life join the Ijams Nature Center for their 36th Annual River Rescue in Knoxville, TN. Cleaning up the same creek every year prevents trash from making its way into the Tennessee River. With the community coming together to participate in this annual cleanup, they educate themselves on the importance of proper waste disposal and serve as an example of how residents can do their part to protect the health of their local watershed.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Air Force veteran Dr. Janell Royster, details her life of trauma both in and out of the military and her passion for giving new life to those who have experienced trauma of every kind!

programme.title: Winchester Life

Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.desc: The Green Turtle Cay adventure continues as the LK crew uncovers more of what the incredible out islands of the Bahamas have to offer. Shifting gears to bottom fishing, Ali catches a fish of a lifetime while Rush gets to dive and spearfish with the locals.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Back in San Diego and with Rockfish on the mind, the LK crew fish new grounds and depths to catch these iconic Southern California bottom fish. Along for the ride is pro snowboarder and friend Dave Downing to round out this epic rock cod fishing trip.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.desc: Day 1 of competition for the 2024 Thousand Islands Open out of downtown Kingston, Ontario.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Discover the pressing threat of Chronic Wasting Disease in North American whitetail deer and the fierce debate around the strategies aimed at its management.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Embark on a journey through Scotland's hunting traditions, exploring bird shoots, grouse moors, and red stag hunts while discovering the evolving role of hunting in conservation.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Navigating the complex issues of deer management, Dan Cabela travels between Scotland and England to learn how land managers balance conservation with wild food harvesting.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Heading to one of the great wilderness areas of North America, Dan Cabela is in search of Stone Sheep in British Columbia. Joining scientists, they embark on an ambitious conservation project to help conserve this incredible species.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When tarpon don’t cooperate, it’s time for Capt. Justin and friend Ethan Register to have a competition for dinner options in the gulf’s grocery store.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Joined by PCB’s Artificial Reef Coordinator Erin Graham Capt Justin fish previously dropped reefs before sinking the famed BLACK PEARL from iconic films right off Panama City Beach, FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "Here at Huckberry, we believe that style isn’t defined solely by what you wear — it’s personified in your morning rituals, your bookshelves and music library, the furniture you choose to spend your waking hours in, and the gear closet that powers your passions and pursuits. Style doesn’t end with your closet, it sparks to life there.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Meet Luke DiTella—once a pro surfer, now the founder of Frank August whiskey, and an all-around Renaissance man. Whether it's barrels at a Jersey beach break or barrels of aged whiskey, Luke knows how to turn life into an art form. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we take a deep dive into Luke’s world at his coastal haven in Monmouth Beach, New Jersey. It’s a place where the salty sea air meets the rich aroma of aged whiskey—a home that’s as rugged yet refined as the man himself. Luke opens his doors to share tales of surfing glory, entrepreneurial grit, and the beautiful chaos of fatherhood (spoiler: they don't care about your design aesthetic).

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Dean Petty is a man of many titles: surfer, carpenter, restaurant owner, coffee roaster. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, he takes us to "Camp Bueno", a minimalist surf sanctuary in Cow Bay, Nova Scotia, he built with his own two hands (and a lot of help from his friends). From a concrete kitchen countertop that took days to grind to perfection, to a barn staircase that turned into a viral meme, it's a place you won’t find anywhere else in the world.

programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Ariel Medero fish with David Moss from the Nature Conservancy out of Hawks Cay sampling the bottom fishing and deep dropping. In between the action they learn about the Nature Conservancy’s mission to promote sustainable and transparent fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in Plantation Boat Mart’s new 36’ Invincible with some muttons for dinner and an epic shallow water sailfish double.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fish with Daiwa’s Marc Mills out of Plantation Boat Mart trying out all of Daiwa’s new jigging equipment.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Huckberry's flagship adventure series is back in Japan and the DIRT crew is hungry as ever for adventure. This time, they’re diving into the Kansai region—where millennia-old traditions flow from the shore of Lake Biwa to surf breaks on the coast. Chef Coleman Griffin gives them a taste of the deep cultural immersion that inspires his culinary practice, from chef knives descended from samurai swords to fermented carp that went on to spawn sushi. And turns out, the perfect meal does exist, and the crew knew it as soon as they had a bite of their final omakase.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Illinois isn’t the first state you think about when it comes to waterfowl, but the Wentz Brothers have dialed in some honey holes over the years. On this episode, a slew of waterfowl experts put to the test some of the newest Winchester waterfowl ammunition during the great migration of the Mississippi Flyway in early December. We’ll also head north to the shores of Kodiak Island, Alaska with Chris and Casey Keefer as they push the limits of Winchester’s new Last Call Double Shot on fast-ripping sea ducks.GUESTS: Zach Wentz (Team Winchester) Nathan Robinson (Winchester Ammunition) Ryan Swaner (Winchester Repeating Arms) Chris Jennings (Ducks Unlimited) Mike Brasher (Ducks Unlimited) Scott Olmsted (American Hunter) Travis Hall (Field & Stream) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Col. Nick Nichols from Folds of Honor and Olympic skeet shooter Dania Vizzi are both proud Americans who have represented their country overseas. Col. Nichols commanded the air in the cockpit of a fighter jet for countless missions during his seven combat tours and Dania donned the stars and bars proudly on her shooting vest as an Olympian in Paris. Now with Winchesters in hand, both are in the Midwest whitetail woods during late November during the back end of the rut hoping to connect on a Missouri monarch.
